page.title: 17PONY TREKKING
page.content: Tomintoul Pony Trekking Centre is situated on the Main Street. It has a comfortable Guest House with all the modern facilities and is also open to non-trekkers. There are 6 stall for the ponies and they are located behind the Guest House. There is a cleaning room and hay store there as well. There are l5 ponies aged from 8 to l7 years. The ponies are the Highland breed which is the biggest of Scotland's native breeds. They can safely carry a child or adult all day long whether they are experienced trekkers or not. There are some equally reliable New Forest and Welsh Mountain ponies for the smaller riders. The ponies go to winter homes when the trekking season is over. The treks go to many places within a lO mile radius of Tomintoul.
